benchmark_details.name: CLiMP (Chinese Language Model Evaluation)
benchmark_details.overview: CLiMP consists of 1,000 minimal pairs for 16 syntactic contrasts in Mandarin, covering 9 major Mandarin linguistic phenomena, providing a framework for evaluating the knowledge of Chinese language models.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate which syntactic phenomena Chinese language models can learn and improve upon.

methodology.calculation: A minimal pair is classified correctly if a language model assigns a higher probability to the grammatical sentence than the ungrammatical one.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better understanding of syntactic phenomena.
methodology.baseline_results: Chinese BERT achieved 81.8% accuracy on average across all phenomena.
methodology.validation: Human agreement was found to be over 95%.
